channel.title: Google Developers Search Blog
channel.description: Latest updates from Google Developers Search team

item.title: Introducing Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, our state-of-the-art image model
item.description: Gemini 2.5 Flash Image is a new state-of-the-art image generation and editing model that allows for blending multiple images, maintaining character consistency, and targeted transformations using natural language, leveraging Gemini's world knowledge, now available through the Gemini API, Google AI Studio, and Vertex AI.]]>

item.title: What's new in Gemini Code Assist
item.description: Gemini Code Assist's Agent Mode, now available in VS Code (Preview) and IntelliJ (Stable), streamlines complex coding tasks by proposing detailed plans for user review and approval. This intelligent, collaborative approach, enhanced with features like inline diffs and persistent chat history, aims to boost developer productivity and efficiency.]]>

item.title: URL context tool for Gemini API now generally available
item.description: The Gemini API's URL Context tool is now generally available, allowing developers to ground prompts using web content instead of manual uploads. This release expands support to PDFs and images.]]>

item.title: Announcing Imagen 4 Fast and the general availability of the Imagen 4 family in the Gemini API
item.description: Google announces the general availability of Imagen 4, its advanced text-to-image model, in the Gemini API and Google AI Studio, featuring significant improvements in text rendering. The new Imagen 4 Fast model, designed for speed and rapid image generation, is now available alongside Imagen 4 and Imagen 4 Ultra, with Imagen 4 and Imagen 4 Ultra also supporting up to 2K resolution image generation.]]>

item.title: Introducing Gemma 3 270M: The compact model for hyper-efficient AI
item.description: Google's new Gemma 3 270M is a compact, 270-million parameter model offering energy efficiency, production-ready quantization, and strong instruction-following, making it a powerful solution for task-specific fine-tuning in on-device and research settings.]]>

item.title: Gemini CLI + VS Code: Native diffing and context-aware workflows
item.description: The latest Gemini CLI update provides a deep IDE integration within VS Code for intelligent, context-aware suggestions, and native in-editor diffing, allowing developers to review and modify proposed changes directly within the diff view for a more efficient workflow.]]>

item.title: Train a GPT2 model with JAX on TPU for free
item.description: Build and train a GPT2 model from scratch using JAX on Google TPUs, with a complete Python notebook for free-tier Colab or Kaggle. Learn how to define a hardware mesh, partition model parameters and input data for data parallelism, and optimize the model training process.]]>

item.title: Meet Julesâ€™ sharpest critic and most valuable ally
item.description: Jules' critic functionality addresses potential issues like subtle bugs and missed edge cases in AI-generated code by acting as a peer reviewer within the generation process. This "critic-augmented generation" means proposed code changes undergo adversarial review, allowing Jules to improve its output and ultimately deliver higher-quality, pre-reviewed code.]]>

item.title: The Google Developer Program is evolving
item.description: The Google Developer Program is rolling out major updates to make its tools and community more accessible and powerful. These enhancements include a new flexible monthly subscription tier, a centralized GDP Forum for collaboration, and increased Gemini CLI access for all members.]]>

item.title: Veo 3 Fast and new image-to-video capabilities
item.description: Google introduces Veo 3 Fast, an optimized model for speed and price, along with new image-to-video capabilities for both Veo 3 and Veo 3 Fast, enabling developers to efficiently create high-quality video content from text or still images, with varying pricing based on the model and audio inclusion, now available in the Gemini API.]]>
